==== Notes ====
* Problems I have had is using the default fglrx driver in dapper.  It will suspend/sleep but it will not hibernate.  It will if I install the latest ati driver.  But I thought that this was included in Dapper.  Also the WiFi light does not work using the led=1 on the ipw2200 modulde. -- Blake14
** Both suspend-to-disk and suspend-to-RAM work for me on Feisty final. -- Jfinkels, 2007-04-24
** I THOUGHT I was able to fix the WiFi indicator light problem using directions from one of the comments under this bug (although this bug is not for the Dell Inspiron 9300) <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/acpi-support/+bug/26464]]</nowiki>. Added a file /etc/modprobe.d/ipw2200 with the contents "options ipw2200 led=1" (one way to do this is to issue the following command: <code>touch /etc/modprobe.d/ipw2200 && echo options ipw2200 led=1 > /etc/modprobe.d/ipw2200</code>). I then removed and reinstalled the ipw2200 driver (using the following command: <code>sudo modprobe -r ipw2200 && sudo modprobe ipw2200</code>). Now pressing <Fn>+<F2> will turn on both the Bluetooth indicator light and the WiFi indicator light (although the WiFi light has about a one second delay). '''HOWEVER''', the light now remains on all the time and only turns off briefly when re-enabling wireless radio once it has been disabled, only to flash back on.
* Main volume control doesn't affect headphone port. -- Blake14
** The volume up, volume down, and mute buttons on the front bezel of the computer only affect the "Master" track. -- Jfinkels, 2007-04-24
